unnormalised: New Delhi - Consumers are increasingly prioritizing fuel efficiency, driving innovation in the Indian automotive sector. A recent study by IIT Madras revealed that optimizing driving habits can improve mileage by up to 15%.
normalised: New Delhi - Consumers are increasingly prioritizing fuel efficiency, driving innovation in the Indian automotive sector. A recent study by I I T Madras revealed that optimizing driving habits can improve mileage by up to fifteen percent.

unnormalised: Dr. Anjali Sharma, lead researcher, emphasized that maintaining consistent speeds and avoiding aggressive acceleration are key. The study, funded by the Ministry of Road Transport, analyzed data from over 500 vehicles across diverse terrains, from the Himalayan foothills to the coastal plains of Kerala.
normalised: Doctor Anjali Sharma, lead researcher, emphasized that maintaining consistent speeds and avoiding aggressive acceleration are key. The study, funded by the Ministry of Road Transport, analyzed data from over five hundred vehicles across diverse terrains, from the Himalayan foothills to the coastal plains of Kerala.

unnormalised: Manufacturers are also responding. Maruti Suzuki announced new engine technologies aimed at boosting fuel economy in their upcoming models. The company claims an increase of 5 km/liter in their popular Alto 800.
normalised: Manufacturers are also responding. Maruti Suzuki announced new engine technologies aimed at boosting fuel economy in their upcoming models. The company claims an increase of five kilometer per liter in their popular Alto eight hundred.

unnormalised: Furthermore, government incentives for hybrid and electric vehicles are playing a significant role. Reduced GST and registration fees make these options more accessible to the average Indian consumer.
normalised: Furthermore, government incentives for hybrid and electric vehicles are playing a significant role. Reduced G S T and registration fees make these options more accessible to the average Indian consumer.

unnormalised: Experts predict a shift towards more fuel-efficient vehicles, impacting both the environment and household budgets. Improved fuel efficiency translates to savings of thousands of Rs. annually, freeing up funds for other expenses, like Diwali celebrations and purchasing that new 1200 sq ft apartment.
normalised: Experts predict a shift towards more fuel-efficient vehicles, impacting both the environment and household budgets. Improved fuel efficiency translates to savings of thousands of rupees annually, freeing up funds for other expenses, like Diwali celebrations and purchasing that new one thousand two hundred square feet apartment.
